p: These methods are based on the transfer of electrons (ET) or the transfer of hydrogen atoms (HAT) [ 96, 97]. Another antioxidant mechanism is the transition metal chelation, (TMC): transition metals ions may be chelated by polyphenols, leading to stable complexed compounds [ 98]. The determination of the antioxidant power should be measured with at least two or three assays [ 99, 100]. A more in-depth and correct investigation must also include the determination of the phenolic content and that of the flavonoids.
